intro: Microlicia warmingiana var. hirtella, commonly known as the hairy microlicia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in countries like Thailand and Malaysia. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. This species is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and adaptability to various soil conditions.
